content: anrheg hat this is my favourite go-to gift pattern anrheg is the welsh word for gift it s fast easy but with a lovely texture it s great for a special skein and is intended to work well with textured self-striping or handspun yarn 1 yarn 100g/4oz of heavy dk or worsted weight yarn needles us size 5/3 75mm circular needle us size 7/4 5mm circular needle plus dpns or longer circular needle in this size for working crown decreases or choose needle size needed to achieve correct gauge notions stitch marker darning needle pop pom maker cardboard or a ready-made pom pom may be substituted scissors gauge 20 sts and 42 row = 4 x 4 inches 10 x 10cm gauge is measured in garter stitch 42 row = 21 garter ridges sizes adult small medium large to fit head circumference 20 22 24 /51 56 61 cm pick the size closest to your head circumference if you are between sizes size down for a tighter fit or size up for a more slouchy fit 2 knitting notes it s possible to further increase or decrease the size of the hat by adding or subtracting stitches in multiples of 10 do bear in mind that the lower the number of stitches cast on the less gathered the crown and vice versa abbreviations co - cast on sts - stitches k - knit p - purl kfb - knit front and back knit into front and back loops of the same stitch one stitch increased sl - slip_stitch purlwise bor - beginning of round wyib - with yarn in back round - round cdd - centred double decrease slip two stitches as if to knit two together knit one stitch then pass the two slipped stitches over it two stitches decreased pattern cast on with smaller needles co 80 90 100 repeat round 1 until work measures sts i used a long tail cast on in the approximately 2 or desired length of samples but you can achieve a less ribbing from cast on edge visible cast on by using a tubular cast on or alternating cable cast on change to larger needles join in the round being careful not to increase round *k9 kfb repeat from twist sts place bor marker for rest of * to end of round pattern slip bor marker every time you reach it unless directed otherwise round 1 *k1 p1 repeat from * to end of round 3 body round 5 remove bor marker sl 1 wyib round 1 *sl1 wyib p10 repeat from * to replace bor marker *k 6 cdd repeat end or round from * to end of round round 2 k all sts round 6 *p6 sl 1 wyib repeat from * to continue until hat measures 6 5 7 5 end or round 8 from cast on or until desired length round 7 remove bor marker sl 1 wyib is reached if you would like a more replace bor
